授業目的:
This seminar provides a practical introduction to processes of social scientific research applied in contexts for international business and management research.

The emphasis is on the practical steps and decisions that students need to take and justify in order to produce a comprehensive and convincing research proposal.

From the Instructor perspective, specific purposes of this GR course include:

To guide GR students towards choosing and designing a research topic and / or series of research questions that interest them most.
To guide GR students towards producing and justifying a research design and proposal that reflects academic and professional standards appropriate for international Masters-level study
到達目標:
By participating actively and collaboratively in this Group Research course, students should individually be able to:

Demonstrate a practical understanding of the knowledge and competencies they need and can develop towards becoming recognised as a professional and ethical researcher in the fields of international business and management.

Gain sufficient knowledge, skills and competencies to manage an independent research project effectively.
授業の概要・背景:
The final design and delivery of the module will be produced after the instructor has made an initial assessment of the average level of research experience of the participants.
Correspondingly, the assessment is individual to each GR student and consists of preparation of a final report examination in the form of a feasible individual research proposal (document) appropriate to international standards for Masters level business and management research.
授業方法:
Seven on-line class sessions.
Home study reading assignments (individual and group) with focus on a set textbook accompanied by tailored readings and case studies selected & distributed by the instructor.
LUNA Discussion Forums on related class themes will be opened in between class sessions.
